topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/540e5a506368723471c60100#post_540e5a506368723471c60100
[bq="SeraphimDawn"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/540e5909636872764ead0100#post_540e5909636872764ead0100
I dunno. But we are reading them. We just don't know how to reply to them.[/bq]
So I'm the resident person that talks about cool shit being worked on that people never thought was possible?

Oh, oh; I got another cool thing; by 2020 a $1000 homecomputer will be as powerful as the human brain.  IBM is developing computer chips to mimic the human brain for personal computers; the reason why this is cool in that it'll pretty much end computer errors in that you'll have a part of your cpu specifically dedicated to fixing computer errors as well as fixing programming errors.  Nanoparticles are being looked at to eliminate ALL viruses.

How lizards regrow limbs has been found out by the Arizona state university; this means in the future humans could regrow limbs cause humans already have the tools to.  Basically the way lizards regrow limbs is that a scab forms, but instead of closing the gap new cartilage forms and a type of stem cells begins dividing and regrowing under the scab.  Humans may very well regrow limbs in the future.

topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/540e5f2e6368726880080000#post_540e5f2e6368726880080000
More along the lines of:
!http://showreality.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/5a9a89c0-b66b-11e3-968a-b388645cf100_7-wolverine-x2.jpg!
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/540e5f6263687277c0d10100#post_540e5f6263687277c0d10100
[bq="SeraphimDawn"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/540e5e5e63687225af320000#post_540e5e5e63687225af320000
Computer chips that mimic human brains? So does that mean real life Vocaloids could be possible?[/bq]
Yes, *BUT*, and I have to stress this, when they first come out they'll be hard to develop and expensive to make.  So while it's entirely possible for Miku and such to become real life androids, but there will probably only be one of each of them cause of how fucking expensive we're talking.  When we eventually have the ability to make androids we're easily talking tens of million dollars for each one cause we're talking experimental prototypes.  Experimental prototypes are fucking expensive.
